provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Privacy or Compliance Program Membership
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent in any manner, expressly or by implication, the extent to which it is a member of, adheres to, or participates in any privacy, security, or other compliance program sponsored by the government or any third party.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain and make available to the FTC, for five years, all documents relating to compliance with this order, including covered advertisements and any documents questioning compliance.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Order Distribution and Acknowledgment
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of this order to all relevant current and future personnel and obtain signed, dated acknowledgments of receipt from each.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Corporate Change Notification
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the FTC at least 30 days prior to any corporate change that may affect compliance obligations under this order, such as dissolution, merger, sale, bankruptcy filing, or name/address change.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file a written compliance report with the FTC within 60 days of service of this order, and at such other times as the Commission may require.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Order Duration
provisions.summary: This order terminates on November 9, 2029, or twenty years from the most recent date a complaint alleging a violation of the order is filed in federal court, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.summary: This order will terminate on January 12, 2030, or twenty years from the most recent date the Commission files a complaint alleging any violation of the order in federal court, whichever is later.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Prohibition on Dissemination of Videos or Photographs Without Consent
provisions.summary: Respondent is permanently prohibited from disseminating, through a website or online service, videos or photographs exposing an individual's intimate parts unless the individual has received a clear disclosure and provided affirmative express written consent.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Prohibition on Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Respondent is permanently prohibited from misrepresenting any material fact through a website or online service, including misrepresentations about data collection/use/disclosure/deletion, Respondent's own identity, and the identity of content providers or advertisers.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Disposition of Personal Information
provisions.summary: Respondent is permanently prohibited from using or disclosing personal information obtained in connection with the Covered Websites prior to entry of this Order, and must destroy all such personal information within 30 days of entry of this Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain and make available to the FTC upon request specific records related to consent, representations about data practices, consumer complaints, law enforcement communications, and any documents questioning compliance.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgment and Delivery
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of this Order to all current and future employees, agents, and representatives with relevant responsibilities, and must obtain signed and dated acknowledgment receipts within 30 days of delivery.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Business Change Notification
provisions.summary: For ten (10) years after the date of issuance of this order, Respondent must notify the Commission of any discontinuance of current business or employment or affiliation with any new business or employment, including contact details and a description of the new role.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file an initial written compliance report with the Commission within 60 days of service of this order, and must submit additional written reports within 10 days of receiving written notice from a Commission representative.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Order Duration
provisions.summary: This order terminates on December 28, 2035, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date the United States or the Commission files a complaint alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later, subject to specified exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Amendment to Section VI – Revised Compliance Monitoring Provision
provisions.summary: Section VI of the original March 13, 2015 Final Order is amended so that John Fanning must notify the Commission for five years (running from the date of the original Final Order's issuance) whenever he discontinues his current business or employment, or affiliates with any new business or employment involving electronic commerce, social media, or the online collection or use of consumer data linked to a specific consumer, computer, or device. Notices must include the new business address, telephone number, a description of the business or employment, and his duties and responsibilities, and must be delivered by email or overnight courier to the specified FTC address.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Preservation of All Other Provisions of the Original Final Order
provisions.summary: All portions of the Commission's original Final Order issued on March 13, 2015, other than Section VI (which is replaced by the revised compliance monitoring provision above), remain in effect without any modification.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Prohibited Misleading Representations
provisions.summary: Respondent and all persons acting in concert with it must not make any misrepresentation, express or implied, about any feature of covered software in connection with its advertising, promotion, sale, or distribution.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Affirmative Express Consent Provision
provisions.summary: No later than 120 days after service of the Order, Respondent must not preinstall any covered software unless affirmative express consent is obtained from the consumer, revocation instructions are provided, and a reasonable opt-out or removal mechanism is available.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Mandated Software Security Program
provisions.summary: Respondent must establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive software security program — documented in writing — containing administrative, technical, and physical safeguards addressing software security risks and protecting the security and integrity of covered information.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Software Security Assessments by a Third Party
provisions.summary: Respondent must obtain initial and biennial third-party assessments of its software security program from a qualified independent professional, covering defined reporting periods, with specific content requirements and submission deadlines to the Commission.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit a sworn acknowledgment of receipt of this Order within 10 days, and for 5 years must deliver a copy of the Order to all principals, officers, directors, and employees or agents with relevant managerial responsibilities, as well as to any successor business entities.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Report and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit a sworn annual compliance report one year after issuance, provide sworn notices within 14 days of changes in contact information or corporate structure, notify the Commission within 14 days of any bankruptcy filing, and route all submissions per specified instructions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create specified records for 20 years after Order issuance and retain each for at least 5 years (unless otherwise specified), including accounting records, personnel records, consumer complaints, representations subject to the Order, assessment materials, and all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to monitor Respondent's compliance by requiring additional reports and records within 10 days of a written request, communicating directly with Respondent, interviewing affiliated individuals (with counsel present), and using all other lawful means including undercover methods.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: This Order is effective upon publication on the FTC's website and will terminate on December 20, 2037, or 20 years from the most recent date a complaint alleging any violation of this Order is filed in federal court, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Participation in or Compliance with Privacy Programs
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent, in any manner, the extent to which it is a member of, adheres to, or participates in any privacy or security program sponsored by a government or self-regulatory organization, including EU-U.S. Privacy Shield, Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield, and APEC Cross-Border Privacy Rules.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must acknowledge receipt of the Order itself, deliver copies to principals, officers, managers, and relevant employees, and obtain signed acknowledgments from each recipient.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Report and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit an initial sworn compliance report within 60 days, and thereafter submit sworn notices within 14 days of any change in contact information, corporate structure, or bankruptcy filing.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create and retain specified records for twenty years after the Order's issuance date, retaining each record for at least five years.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC may monitor Respondent's compliance by requesting additional reports, inspecting records, conducting interviews, and using undercover means without prior notice.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: The Order is effective upon publication on ftc.gov and terminates on January 23, 2040, or twenty years from the most recent date the Commission files a complaint alleging a violation, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.summary: Respondent must either affirm to the Department of Commerce that it will continue to apply Privacy Shield principles (or protect data by another EU-authorized means) or return/delete the personal information, within ten days of the order's effective date.

provisions.summary: Each Covered Business must establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive information security program protecting the security, confidentiality, and integrity of Personal Information, including specific technical, operational, and administrative safeguards.

provisions.title: Cooperation with Third Party Information Security Assessor
provisions.summary: Respondents must fully cooperate with the third-party Assessor by disclosing all material facts without misrepresentation and providing all relevant information and materials in their possession.

provisions.title: Annual Certification
provisions.summary: Respondents must annually certify to the Commission, under the signature of a senior corporate manager or officer, that each Covered Business has established and maintained the Order's requirements, is not aware of uncorrected material noncompliance, and includes a description of any Covered Incident.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Covered Incident Reports
provisions.summary: Respondents must submit a report to the Commission within ten days after first notifying any government entity of a Covered Incident, including details about the incident, affected information, affected consumers, remediation steps, and copies of notices sent.

provisions.summary: The Order is effective upon publication on ftc.gov and terminates twenty (20) years from issuance, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date a complaint alleging a violation is filed in federal court, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Prohibition against Misrepresentations about Participation in or Compliance with Privacy Programs
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent, in any manner, its membership in, adherence to, certification by, or participation in any privacy or security program sponsored by a government or self-regulatory organization, including the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield, Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield, and APEC Cross-Border Privacy Rules.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Requirement to Meet Continuing Obligations Under Privacy Shield
provisions.summary: Respondent must either affirm to the Department of Commerce that it will continue applying Privacy Shield principles (or protect data by another EU-authorized means) within 10 days and annually thereafter, or return or delete the information within 10 days of the Order's effective date.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit its own acknowledgment of receipt to the FTC within 10 days, deliver copies of the Order to relevant personnel and business successors for 10 years, and obtain signed acknowledgments from each recipient within 30 days of delivery.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Report and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must file an initial sworn compliance report within 60 days, submit sworn notices of material changes within 14 days, notify the FTC of any bankruptcy filing within 14 days, ensure all sworn submissions comply with 28 U.S.C. § 1746, and route all submissions to the designated FTC email or address.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create specified records for 10 years after the Order's issuance date and retain each such record for 5 years, covering accounting records, personnel records, compliance documentation, and copies of representations subject to the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: Respondent must cooperate with FTC monitoring, including submitting additional compliance reports or records within 10 days of written request, permitting direct communications and interviews, and allowing the Commission to use all lawful investigative means including undercover contacts.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: The Order is final and effective upon publication on the FTC's website and will terminate on January 23, 2040, or 20 years from the most recent date the United States or Commission files a federal court complaint alleging a violation, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent, in any manner, the extent to which it participates in, is certified by, or complies with any government or self-regulatory privacy or security program, including the EU-U.S. and Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield frameworks.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must acknowledge receipt of the Order itself, deliver copies to relevant personnel and successors, and obtain signed acknowledgments from each recipient.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Report and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit an initial sworn compliance report 60 days after issuance, submit sworn notices of material changes within 14 days, notify the Commission of any bankruptcy filing within 14 days, and route all submissions per specified instructions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create and retain specified business, personnel, compliance, and advertising records for 20 years (creation) and 5 years (retention) after the issuance date.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to monitor Respondent's compliance by requesting reports and records, conducting interviews, and using other lawful investigative means including undercover methods.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates

provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent, in any manner, the extent to which it participates in, complies with, or is certified by any government or self-regulatory privacy or security program, including the EU-U.S. and Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield frameworks.

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must obtain and submit acknowledgments of receipt of the Order from itself and relevant personnel within specified timeframes.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Report and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit a sworn initial compliance report within 60 days, and timely compliance notices upon changes in contact, structure, or bankruptcy filings.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create and retain specified records for 10 years (creation) and 5 years (retention), covering personnel, compliance, and representations.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to monitor Respondent's compliance through document requests, direct communications, interviews, and other lawful means including undercover inquiries.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: The Order is effective upon publication on the FTC website and terminates on January 13, 2040, or 20 years from the most recent date a complaint alleging any violation is filed in federal court, whichever is later.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent, expressly or by implication, the extent to which it collects, maintains, uses, or protects the privacy and security of any Covered Information.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Data Retention and Deletion
provisions.summary: Within 60 days, Respondent must document and follow a Covered Information retention schedule and provide consumers a Clear and Conspicuous link to request data access or deletion.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Multi-Factor Authentication for Users
provisions.summary: Within six months, Respondent must offer multi-factor authentication to consumer users and must not use MFA-collected information for any other purpose.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Notice to Individuals Affected by Identified Breaches
provisions.summary: Within 60 days, Respondent must email the prescribed breach notice (Attachment A) to each individual whose sensitive information was exposed in an Identified Breach and not yet notified.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Mandated Information Security Program
provisions.summary: Within 90 days, Respondent must establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive information security program covering documentation, risk assessments, safeguards, employee training, access controls, MFA, encryption, vulnerability management, and service provider oversight.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Information Security Assessments By A Third Party
provisions.summary: Respondent must obtain initial and biennial independent third-party assessments of its Information Security Program, submit the initial assessment to the FTC within 10 days of completion, and retain subsequent assessments for FTC review on request.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Cooperation With Third-Party Information Security Assessor
provisions.summary: Respondent must fully cooperate with third-party Assessors by providing all relevant information, network and IT asset visibility, and disclosing all material facts without misrepresentation.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Annual Certifications
provisions.summary: Beginning one year after Order issuance and annually thereafter, a senior corporate manager or officer must certify to the FTC that Respondent has established and maintained Order requirements and is unaware of uncorrected material noncompliance.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Covered Incident Reports
provisions.summary: Within ten days of notifying any U.S. government entity of a Covered Incident, Respondent must submit a detailed report to the FTC including dates, descriptions, affected consumer counts, remediation actions, and copies of consumer notices.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgements
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit its own sworn acknowledgment of the Order within 10 days, deliver copies to relevant personnel, and obtain signed acknowledgments from each recipient within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file an initial sworn compliance report one year after issuance, provide sworn notices of material changes within 14 days for 12 years, and notify the FTC of any bankruptcy filing within 14 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create and retain for 5 years (over a 12-year creation period) records including accounting data, personnel records, consumer complaints, all compliance documentation, and copies of privacy/security-related marketing materials.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC may monitor Respondent's compliance by requesting additional reports, conducting depositions and document inspections, communicating directly with Respondent, interviewing affiliated personnel, and using other lawful means including undercover methods.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates and Duration
provisions.summary: The Order is effective upon publication on ftc.gov and terminates 20 years from issuance or 20 years from the most recent federal court complaint alleging a violation, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Corporate Respondent must not misrepresent how it collects, uses, discloses, or protects Covered Information, or misrepresent the extent of any Covered Incident or unauthorized disclosure.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Mandated Deletion and Data Minimization
provisions.summary: Corporate Respondent must delete all Covered Information not being used for customer services within 60 days, report the deletion to the Commission, and refrain from collecting or maintaining unnecessary Covered Information going forward.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Data Retention Limits
provisions.summary: Corporate Respondent must document, adhere to, and publicly post a retention schedule for Covered Information within 60 days, report it to the Commission, and update the schedule before collecting any new types of consumer information.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Mandated Information Security Program for Covered Businesses
provisions.summary: Corporate Respondent and all Covered Businesses must establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive information security program within 60 days, meeting detailed minimum requirements including written documentation, risk assessments, safeguards, training, access controls, monitoring, and vendor management.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Third Party Information Security Assessments for Covered Businesses
provisions.summary: Corporate Respondent must obtain initial and biennial independent third-party assessments of its Information Security Program, using a qualified assessor approved by the FTC, covering defined reporting periods for 20 years, with completed assessments submitted to the Commission.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Cooperation with Third-Party Information Security Assessor
provisions.summary: Respondents must fully cooperate with the third-party assessor by providing all relevant information, granting network and IT asset visibility, and disclosing all material facts without misrepresentation.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Mandated Information Security Program for Certain Businesses of the Individual Respondent
provisions.summary: For 10 years after issuance, Individual Respondent must ensure that any Relevant Business for which he is a majority owner or senior officer with information security responsibility establishes and maintains a comprehensive information security program meeting detailed minimum requirements within 180 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Annual Certification
provisions.summary: Corporate Respondent must submit an annual certification to the Commission from its CEO (or designated senior officer) confirming compliance with the Order, absence of uncorrected material noncompliance, and describing all verified Covered Incidents during the certified period.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Covered Incident Reports
provisions.summary: Within 10 days of notifying any U.S. government entity of a Covered Incident, each Covered Business must submit a detailed report to the Commission including the date, facts, types and number of consumers affected, remediation steps, and copies of consumer notices.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Each Respondent must acknowledge receipt of the Order within 10 days, deliver copies of the Order to all relevant principals, officers, and employees within 10 days (and to future personnel before they assume responsibilities), and obtain signed acknowledgments from each recipient within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Compliance Report and Notices
provisions.summary: Each Respondent must submit an initial compliance report one year after issuance, provide timely notices of any material changes (within 14 days), and notify the Commission of any bankruptcy filings within 14 days, with all submissions made under penalty of perjury.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondents must create records for 20 years and retain them for 5 years (unless otherwise specified), covering accounting records, personnel records, consumer complaints, advertising materials, privacy representations, Assessment materials, law enforcement communications, noncompliance records, and all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to monitor Respondents' compliance by requesting additional reports and records within 10 days, communicating directly with and interviewing affiliated persons, and using any other lawful means including undercover methods.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates and Duration
provisions.summary: This Order is effective upon publication on the FTC's website and terminates 20 years from its issuance date, or 20 years from the most recent date the Commission files a complaint alleging a violation, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Prohibition against Misrepresentations about Privacy and Security
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent, expressly or by implication, its privacy and security measures, program memberships, user privacy choices, deletion/retention practices, or the extent to which it protects Personal Information.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Mandated Information Security Program
provisions.summary: Respondent must establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive information security program within 60 days of order issuance, meeting a detailed set of minimum requirements covering documentation, risk assessment, safeguards, testing, and vendor management.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Independent Program Assessments by a Third Party
provisions.summary: Respondent must obtain initial and biennial third-party assessments of its Information Security Program, using qualified independent assessors approved by the FTC, covering specified reporting periods and content requirements, and submit results to the Commission.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Cooperation with Third Party Information Security Assessor
provisions.summary: Respondent must fully cooperate with the third-party Assessor by providing all relevant information, network and IT asset visibility, and disclosing all material facts without misrepresentation.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Annual Certification
provisions.summary: Respondent must annually provide the FTC with a sworn certification from a senior corporate manager or officer confirming compliance with the Order, disclosing any material noncompliance, and describing all Covered Incidents during the period.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Covered Incident Reports
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit a report to the FTC within 30 days of discovering a Covered Incident, including details about the incident's date, causes, affected information types, number of consumers affected, remediation steps, and copies of consumer notices.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Monetary Relief
provisions.summary: Respondent must pay $500,000 to the Commission within 8 days of the effective date of the Order via electronic fund transfer.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Additional Monetary Provisions
provisions.summary: Respondent relinquishes all rights to transferred assets, the Complaint facts are deemed true in any subsequent enforcement litigation, paid funds may be used for consumer redress or related relief, and interest and penalties accrue on default.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Customer Information
provisions.summary: Respondent must provide sufficient customer information to enable the Commission to administer consumer redress to shopkeepers who did not receive payable commissions, and must respond to written information requests within 14 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit a sworn acknowledgment of the Order within 10 days, deliver copies to all key personnel and future personnel before they assume responsibilities, and obtain signed acknowledgments from each recipient within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Compliance Reports and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit an annual compliance report sworn under penalty of perjury one year after issuance, and provide timely notices of changes in contact information, corporate structure, or bankruptcy filings; all submissions must follow specified format and delivery instructions.

provisions.summary: Respondent must create specified records for 20 years after order issuance and retain each for 5 years, covering accounting, personnel, consumer complaints, advertising, privacy representations, assessment materials, law enforcement communications, and noncompliance records.

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Billing Without Express, Informed Consent
provisions.summary: Respondent is prohibited from billing an Account Holder for any Charge without first obtaining Express, Informed Consent. If Respondent obtains consent for future charges, it must provide a simple mechanism to revoke that consent at any time.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Denying Account Access for Disputing Charges
provisions.summary: Respondent is permanently prohibited from denying, temporarily or permanently, a consumer's access to or use of their account — including any paid-for goods or services — for reasons that include the consumer's dispute of a Charge.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.summary: Respondent relinquishes all rights to assets transferred under this Order; complaint facts are taken as true in subsequent litigation; money paid may be used for consumer redress; interest accrues on default; daily nonpayment constitutes a separate violation; and Respondent's Taxpayer ID may be used for collecting delinquent amounts.

provisions.title: Prohibited Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Respondent and all persons acting with it must not make any express or implied misrepresentations about the accuracy, efficacy, comparative bias performance, or liveness detection of its Facial Recognition Technology.

provisions.title: Prohibition on Unsubstantiated Accuracy and Bias Claims
provisions.summary: Respondent must not make any representation about the effectiveness, accuracy, lack of bias, or spoofing detection of its Facial Recognition Technology unless it possesses and relies upon competent and reliable testing that substantiates the claim at the time it is made.

provisions.summary: Respondent must submit a sworn acknowledgment of receipt to the FTC, deliver copies of the Order to principals, officers, employees, and agents, and collect signed acknowledgments from each recipient.
