provisions.title: Order Delivery and Acknowledgment
provisions.summary: For five years from issuance, respondents must deliver a copy of the order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, and managers engaged in related conduct, and obtain signed, dated acknowledgments of receipt within 30 days of delivery.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Notification of Corporate Changes
provisions.summary: Respondents must notify the FTC at least 30 days before any corporate change that may affect compliance obligations, such as dissolution, merger, sale, subsidiary creation, bankruptcy filing, or name/address change, with notices sent by overnight courier or first-class mail with simultaneous email.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondents must each file a written compliance report with the FTC within 60 days of service of the order, and submit additional written reports within 10 days of any written request from the Commission.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: The order terminates on March 14, 2031, or 20 years from the most recent date a federal court complaint alleging a violation of the order is filed, whichever is later, with specific carve-outs for provisions with shorter terms and for respondents not named as defendants.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Privacy Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Respondents must not misrepresent the extent to which they maintain privacy or confidentiality of consumer data, including collection, use, disclosure, or sharing practices, or the extent to which software code determines whether a user has previously visited a webpage.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Prohibition on History Sniffing
provisions.summary: Respondents are prohibited from collecting any data through history sniffing or using any data obtained by history sniffing.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Data Deletion and Non-Use Requirements
provisions.summary: Respondents must not use, disclose, sell, rent, lease, or transfer any information collected using history sniffing, and must permanently delete or destroy all such information within five days, providing written confirmation to the Commission.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Recordkeeping Requirements
provisions.summary: Respondents must maintain and make available to the FTC records including consumer complaints, compliance records, and publicly disseminated documents related to data collection and privacy practices for specified retention periods.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgment Requirements
provisions.summary: Respondents must deliver a copy of this order to current and future principals, officers, directors, managers, and relevant personnel for three years, securing signed acknowledgments of receipt.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Change in Corporate Status Notification
provisions.summary: Respondents must notify the Commission at least thirty days prior to any change in corporate structure or status that may affect compliance obligations, including dissolution, merger, sale, bankruptcy, or change of name or address.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondents must file a true and accurate compliance report with the Commission within ninety days after service of the order and submit additional reports upon request within ten days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: This order terminates on March 13, 2033, or twenty years from the most recent date a complaint alleging violation is filed in federal court, whichever comes later, subject to specified exceptions and conditions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Monitoring Technology Prohibited
provisions.summary: Respondent is permanently prohibited from using monitoring technology to gather, receive, store, or communicate data from computers rented to consumers, except when providing consumer-initiated technical assistance.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Use of Tracking Technology Limited
provisions.summary: Respondent must provide clear and prominent notice and obtain affirmative express consent before using geophysical location tracking technology on rented consumer products, with specific notice requirements for computers including desktop icons.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: No Deceptive Gathering of Consumer Information
provisions.summary: Respondent is prohibited from making false representations in any notice, prompt, or software application that results in gathering consumer data or information.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: No Use of Improperly Obtained Information in Collections
provisions.summary: Respondent is prohibited from using any data obtained in violation of Parts I, II, and III when collecting or attempting to collect debts.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Protection of Data
provisions.summary: Respondent must delete or destroy data previously gathered using non-compliant monitoring or tracking technology and ensure data transfers are encrypted during transmission.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: No Misrepresentations About Privacy
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent the extent to which it maintains and protects the security, privacy, or confidentiality of consumer data.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Oversight and Monitoring of Franchisees
provisions.summary: Respondent must require franchisees to comply with order requirements, prohibit franchisees from violating provisions within 30 days, monitor franchisee compliance annually, and take corrective action or terminate non-compliant franchisees.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Distribution of Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver copies of the order to all current and future personnel and franchisee principals with relevant responsibilities and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file initial and ongoing compliance reports with the Commission, notify the Commission of corporate changes at least 30 days in advance, and respond to additional reporting requests within 10 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain and make available to the FTC for five years all documents related to consumer privacy complaints, compliance with the order, and acknowledgments of receipt.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Termination of Order
provisions.summary: Order terminates on March 10, 2034, or twenty years from the most recent date the FTC files a complaint alleging violation of the order in federal court, whichever comes later.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Covered Software
provisions.summary: Oracle must not misrepresent the privacy or security of its Covered Software or how to uninstall older Iterations of the Covered Software.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Disclosure Requirements During Java SE Installation or Update
provisions.summary: During any installation or update of Java SE released after service of the order, Oracle must clearly and conspicuously disclose older installed Iterations, warn of security risks from retaining them, and provide instructions for uninstalling them.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Notification to Affected Consumers of Older Insecure Java SE Iterations
provisions.summary: Oracle must notify Affected Consumers that they may have older, insecure Iterations of Java SE on their computers, including via website hyperlink, security bulletins, social media, and by providing free uninstall tools and support.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Oracle must maintain and make available to the FTC for five years all documents relating to compliance with the order, including advertisements, release notes, and any documents contradicting compliance.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Order Distribution and Acknowledgment
provisions.summary: Oracle must deliver a copy of the order to relevant current and future subsidiaries, officers, directors, managers, and supervisory employees, and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt within 30 days of delivery.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Notice of Corporate Changes
provisions.summary: Oracle must notify the FTC at least 30 days prior to any corporate changes that may affect compliance obligations, such as dissolution, merger, sale, bankruptcy filing, or name/address change.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Oracle must file an initial written compliance report with the FTC within 90 days of service of the order, and submit additional reports within 10 days of written request from the Commission.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Order Duration
provisions.summary: The order terminates on March 28, 2036, or 20 years from the most recent date the FTC files a complaint alleging any order violation in federal court, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Prohibition on the Disclosure of Sensitive Personal Information
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently enjoined from selling, transferring, or otherwise disclosing consumers' Sensitive Personal Information to any person, with limited exceptions for payment processing with express consumer consent.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b) and Section 5(a) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Prohibited Misrepresentations Relating to Financial Products or Services
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently enjoined from misrepresenting the likelihood that any person will obtain a loan or credit, or the terms and rates available for any loan or extension of credit.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b) and Section 5(a) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Prohibited Misrepresentations Relating to All Products or Services
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently enjoined from misrepresenting consumer authorization, product outcomes, refund/cancellation policies, or any material fact about any product or service.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b) and Section 5(a) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Consumer Information
provisions.summary: Defendant must provide consumer information to the FTC upon request, is prohibited from using or disclosing consumer information obtained prior to the Order, and must destroy all such consumer information within 30 days of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b) and Section 5(a) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Monetary Judgment
provisions.summary: A judgment of $4,124,710 is entered in favor of the FTC but suspended based on the accuracy of Defendant's financial disclosures; the suspension may be lifted if material misstatements are found, and all paid funds are used for consumer redress or equitable relief.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b) and Section 5(a) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgments
provisions.summary: Defendant must acknowledge receipt of the Order, deliver copies to relevant personnel and business entities, and obtain signed acknowledgments from all recipients.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b) and Section 5(a) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit a sworn compliance report one year after the Order, provide notice of material changes within 14 days for 20 years, notify the FTC of any bankruptcy filing within 14 days, and submit all sworn filings in the required format and manner.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b) and Section 5(a) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Defendant must create specified records for 20 years after entry of the Order and retain each record for 5 years, covering consumer consent records, accounting records, personnel records, complaints, compliance documentation, and marketing materials.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b) and Section 5(a) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC has broad authority to monitor Defendant's compliance, including demanding information, conducting depositions, using discovery procedures, communicating directly with Defendant's personnel, and employing undercover methods.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b) and Section 5(a) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction over this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b) and Section 5(a) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Violating FTC Order
provisions.summary: Defendant and all persons acting in concert with it are permanently enjoined from violating, directly or indirectly, any provision of the 2012 FTC Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(l) and Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(l) and 56(a)(1)

provisions.title: Civil Penalty Judgment
provisions.summary: A civil penalty judgment of $500,000 is entered against Defendant, which must be paid within 7 days of entry of this Order via electronic fund transfer.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(l) and Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(l) and 56(a)(1)

provisions.title: Evaluation of Informed User Consent to Data Collection and Use
provisions.summary: Before making any Targeting Tool available to consumers, Defendant must obtain an evaluation and report from a qualified, FTC-approved third-party professional certifying compliance with the FTC Order's disclosure and consent requirements.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(l) and Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(l) and 56(a)(1)

provisions.title: Assessment of Targeting Tool
provisions.summary: For any assessment conducted under Section VI of the FTC Order, Defendant must obtain advance written approval from the FTC Associate Director for Enforcement for the assessment's scope and design.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(l) and Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(l) and 56(a)(1)

provisions.title: Removal of the RewardU Toolbar and Associated Cookies
provisions.summary: Defendant must permanently expire all RewardU-related cookies and notify all affected consumers to uninstall the toolbar and delete associated cookies within 30 days of entry of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(l) and Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(l) and 56(a)(1)

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgments
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit a sworn acknowledgment of receipt of the Order to the FTC within 7 days, deliver copies of the Order to all principals and relevant personnel, and obtain signed acknowledgments from each recipient within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(l) and Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(l) and 56(a)(1)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit a sworn compliance report one year after entry of the Order, and for 20 years thereafter must submit sworn compliance notices within 14 days of certain changes in structure or contact information, and within 14 days of any bankruptcy filing.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(l) and Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(l) and 56(a)(1)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Defendant must create certain records for 20 years after entry of the Order and retain each such record for 5 years, including compliance records, accounting records, and personnel records.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(l) and Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(l) and 56(a)(1)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: Plaintiff and the FTC have broad rights to monitor Defendant's compliance, including demanding additional reports, conducting depositions and discovery, communicating directly with Defendant, and using undercover means, all without further court order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(l) and Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(l) and 56(a)(1)

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction of this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of this Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(l) and Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(l) and 56(a)(1)

provisions.title: Disclosure and Consent for Targeting Tool
provisions.summary: Respondent must clearly and prominently disclose all types of data collected and how it is used, and must obtain express affirmative consent from consumers prior to enabling any Targeting Tool, including for previously installed TurboSaver Toolbars before making material changes.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(l) and Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(l) and 56(a)(1)

provisions.title: Notification to Affected Consumers
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify Affected Consumers about the Personalized Offers feature, the data collected, and how to disable and uninstall the TurboSaver Toolbar through website posting, direct consumer inquiries, and direct notice.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(l) and Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(l) and 56(a)(1)

provisions.title: Deletion of Collected Information
provisions.summary: Respondent must delete or destroy all Collected Information in its custody or control within 5 days of service of the FTC Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(l) and Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(l) and 56(a)(1)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Privacy and Security
provisions.summary: Respondent must not make any false or misleading representations about the extent to which it maintains and protects the security, privacy, confidentiality, or integrity of personal information collected from consumers.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(l) and Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(l) and 56(a)(1)

provisions.title: Comprehensive Information Security Program
provisions.summary: Respondent must establish and maintain a comprehensive, fully documented information security program with administrative, technical, and physical safeguards appropriate to its size, complexity, and the sensitivity of the personal information it collects.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(l) and Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(l) and 56(a)(1)

provisions.title: Third-Party Security Assessments of Covered Online Services
provisions.summary: Respondent must obtain initial and biennial third-party security assessments for any Covered Online Service from a qualified, independent professional, covering the first 180 days and each two-year period thereafter for 20 years.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(l) and Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(l) and 56(a)(1)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain and make available for FTC inspection, for 5 years after the last dissemination of any covered representation, all advertisements, supporting materials, contradicting evidence, and Order acknowledgments; and for 3 years after each assessment, all materials used to prepare that assessment.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(l) and Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(l) and 56(a)(1)

provisions.title: Cooperation with the Commission
provisions.summary: Respondent must cooperate in good faith with the FTC in connection with this action or any related subsequent investigation, appearing for interviews, conferences, discovery, and proceedings as reasonably requested.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(l) and Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(l) and 56(a)(1)

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgments
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of the FTC Order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, and relevant managers, and obtain a signed and dated acknowledgment from each recipient.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(l) and Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(l) and 56(a)(1)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting / Notification of Changes
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the FTC at least 30 days prior to any change that may affect compliance obligations, including dissolution, sale, merger, creation or dissolution of subsidiaries, bankruptcy filing, or change in name or address.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(l) and Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(l) and 56(a)(1)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file a written compliance report within 60 days of service of the FTC Order and submit additional written reports within 10 days of the FTC's written request.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(l) and Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(l) and 56(a)(1)

provisions.title: Order Duration / Termination
provisions.summary: The FTC Order terminates on December 31, 2031, or 20 years from the most recent date the United States or the FTC files a complaint alleging any violation of the order in federal court, whichever is later.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(l) and Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(l) and 56(a)(1)

provisions.title: Use of Facial Recognition or Analysis Systems Prohibited
provisions.summary: Respondents are banned from using facial recognition technology in retail stores, pharmacies, or online platforms for five years.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Deletion of Covered Biometric Information
provisions.summary: Respondents must delete all photos and videos collected from facial recognition systems and notify third parties to do the same.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Mandated Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance System Monitoring Program
provisions.summary: Before using any biometric surveillance system, Respondents must establish a comprehensive monitoring program to assess and mitigate risks of harm to consumers, including discriminatory impacts.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Mandatory Notice and Complaint Procedures for Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance Systems
provisions.summary: Respondents must provide written notice to consumers enrolled in biometric galleries or affected by system outputs, and establish complaint procedures with required response times.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Required Retention Limits for Biometric Information
provisions.summary: Respondents must develop written retention schedules for biometric information with deletion timeframes no greater than 5 years unless required by law or with consent.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Disclosure of Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance Systems
provisions.summary: Respondents must post Clear and Conspicuous notices disclosing use of biometric surveillance systems in all locations where they are deployed.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Respondents must not misrepresent their privacy, security, or data practices related to Covered Information.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Mandated Information Security Program for Covered Businesses
provisions.summary: Respondents must establish and maintain a comprehensive information security program with specific technical, administrative, and vendor management safeguards.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Third Party Information Security Assessments for Covered Businesses
provisions.summary: Respondents must obtain initial and biennial third-party assessments of their Information Security Program for 20 years.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Cooperation with Third-Party Information Security Assessor
provisions.summary: Respondents must provide all relevant information to the third-party Assessor and not misrepresent any material facts.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Annual Certification
provisions.summary: Respondents must provide annual certifications from the CEO or senior officer confirming compliance with the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Covered Incident Reports
provisions.summary: Respondents must report to the FTC any Covered Incidents affecting 500 or more consumers within 10 days of notifying government entities.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondents must obtain signed acknowledgments of the Order from all relevant personnel and entities for 20 years.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Compliance Reports and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondents must submit annual compliance reports and timely notices of any structural changes or bankruptcy proceedings.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondents must create and retain records for 20 years documenting compliance with all provisions of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC has authority to monitor compliance through requests for reports, depositions, document production, and interviews.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Modification of Original Decision and Order
provisions.summary: This Order supersedes the 2010 Decision and Order previously issued against Rite Aid.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: The Order is effective upon publication on ftc.gov and terminates 20 years from issuance or from the most recent complaint filing, whichever is later.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 5(a) and 5(n) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), (n)

provisions.title: Use of Facial Recognition or Analysis Systems Prohibited
provisions.summary: Respondents are prohibited for five years from deploying or using any Facial Recognition or Analysis System in any retail store, retail pharmacy, or online retail platform.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Deletion of Covered Biometric Information
provisions.summary: Respondents must delete all consumer photos and videos used with facial recognition systems within 45 days, notifythird parties and instruct them to delete within 60 days, and forward third-party deletion confirmations within 10 days of receipt.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Mandated Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance System Monitoring Program
provisions.summary: Before using any Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance System, Respondents must establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive monitoring Program that identifies and addresses consumer risks, including disproportionate impacts by race, ethnicity, gender, sex, age, or disability.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Mandatory Notice and Complaint Procedures for Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance Systems
provisions.summary: Before using any Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance System, Respondents must establish and maintain procedures providing consumers with notice of Gallery enrollment and Output-based actions, and a process for submitting and responding to complaints.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Required Retention Limits for Biometric Information
provisions.summary: Before implementing any Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance System, Respondents must develop and implement a written retention schedule for each type of consumer Biometric Information, setting out purposes, a deletion timeframe of no greater than five years, and the basis for that timeframe.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Disclosure of Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance Systems
provisions.summary: Within 30 days of the effective date, Respondents must post Clear and Conspicuous notices in each retail location and on each website/app/online service disclosing their use of Automated Biometric Security or Surveillance Systems, including types of biometric data collected, outputs generated, purposes, and deletion timeframes.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Respondents must not misrepresent in any manner the extent to which they maintain and protect the privacy, security, confidentiality, or integrity of Covered Information.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Mandated Information Security Program for Covered Businesses
provisions.summary: Within 90 days of the effective date, Respondents must establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive Information Security Program protecting the security, confidentiality, and integrity of Covered Information, including extensive safeguards, vendor management, and ongoing risk assessments.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Third Party Information Security Assessments for Covered Businesses
provisions.summary: Respondents must obtain initial and biennial independent third-party assessments of their Information Security Program, covering the first 180 days after the Program is established and every two years thereafter for 20 years.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Cooperation with Third-Party Information Security Assessor
provisions.summary: Respondents must fully cooperate with the Assessor by providing all relevant information, disclosing network and IT asset details, and not misrepresenting any material facts to the Assessor.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Annual Certification
provisions.summary: One year after issuance, and each year thereafter, Respondents must provide the FTC with a sworn certification from a senior executive confirming compliance with the Order, absence of uncorrected/undisclosed material noncompliance, and a description of all qualifying Covered Incidents during the certified period.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Covered Incident Reports
provisions.summary: Within 10 days of notifying any U.S. government entity of a Covered Incident affecting 500 or more consumers, Respondents must submit a detailed report to the FTC.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondents must submit acknowledgment of receipt of the Order within 10 days, deliver copies to all principals, officers, directors, subsidiaries, and relevant employees, and obtain signed acknowledgments within 30 days of delivery.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Compliance Reports and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondents must submit annual compliance reports, compliance notices within 14 days of changes in contact information or corporate structure, and bankruptcy filing notices within 14 days of filing.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondents must create certain records for 20 years after issuance and retain each for five years, including accounting records, personnel records, consumer complaints, compliance records, System Assessment materials, security representations, Assessor materials, law enforcement subpoenas, and noncompliance records.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC is authorized to monitor Respondents' compliance through requests for reports and records, depositions, discovery, direct communications, interviews, and undercover methods, with Respondents obligated to respond within 14 days of written requests.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Modification of Original Decision and Order
provisions.summary: This Decision and Order supersedes and replaces the Commission's 2010 Decision and Order in In re Rite Aid Corporation, C-4308.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates and Duration
provisions.summary: The Order is effective upon publication on the FTC's website and terminates 20 years from issuance or 20 years from the most recent federal court complaint alleging a violation, whichever is later, with specified exceptions for individual provisions, non-defendant respondents, and dismissed complaints.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against False or Misleading Representations About Personal Information
provisions.summary: Respondent is prohibited from making any false or misleading representation, express or implied, regarding the collection, use, or disclosure of personally identifiable information from consumers.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Prohibition on Disclosure of Pre-Order Consumer Information for Marketing
provisions.summary: Respondent must not sell, rent, or disclose to any third party for marketing purposes any personally identifiable information collected from consumers prior to the date of service of this Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Conditional Prohibition on Disclosure of Post-Order Consumer Information for Marketing
provisions.summary: Respondent must not sell, rent, or disclose post-Order consumer information for marketing purposes unless it first provided the merchant customer a clear written notice and obtained written certification, or provided a clear disclosure directly to consumers about Respondent's data practices.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Monetary Disgorgement Payment
provisions.summary: Respondent must pay $9,101.63 to the United States Treasury as disgorgement within five days of service of this Order, with interest accruing on any default balance.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain and make available to the FTC for five years all documents demonstrating compliance with the Order, including privacy statements, merchant notices and certifications, and records of third-party disclosures.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgment and Delivery
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of the Order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, managers, employees, agents, and representatives with relevant responsibilities, and obtain signed, dated acknowledgments of receipt.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Notification of Corporate Changes
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the FTC at least 30 days prior to any corporate change that may affect compliance obligations under this Order, including dissolution, sale, merger, bankruptcy filings, or name/address changes.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file a written compliance report with the FTC within sixty days of service of this Order, and at such other times as the FTC may require.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: The Order terminates on April 19, 2025, or twenty years from the most recent date a complaint alleging an Order violation is filed in federal court, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Security
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent in any manner, expressly or by implication, the extent to which it maintains and protects the privacy, confidentiality, security, or integrity of personal information collected from consumers.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq

provisions.title: Comprehensive Information Security Program
provisions.summary: Respondent must establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive information security program, fully documented in writing, with administrative, technical, and physical safeguards appropriate to the sensitivity of personal information collected.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq

provisions.title: Third-Party Security Assessments
provisions.summary: Respondent must obtain initial and biennial third-party security assessments from a qualified, independent professional covering the first 180 days after service of the order and each two-year period thereafter for ten years.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain and make available to the FTC documents relating to compliance, including documents contradicting compliance for five years and all materials relating to biennial Assessments for three years after preparation of each Assessment.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq

provisions.title: Order Delivery and Acknowledgment
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of this order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, managers, and employees with managerial responsibilities related to the order's subject matter, within specified timeframes.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq

provisions.title: Corporate Change Notification
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the FTC at least 30 days prior to any corporate change that may affect compliance obligations under this order, such as dissolution, merger, sale, name change, or bankruptcy filing.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file an initial written compliance report with the FTC within 180 days after service of the order, and at such other times as the Commission may require.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq

provisions.title: Order Duration
provisions.summary: This order terminates on March 30, 2027, or twenty years from the most recent date the FTC files a complaint alleging any violation of the order in federal court, whichever is later.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Privacy and Security
provisions.summary: Respondents must not misrepresent in any manner, expressly or by implication, the extent to which they maintain and protect the privacy, confidentiality, or integrity of personal information collected from consumers.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Comprehensive Information Security Program
provisions.summary: Respondents must establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive information security program with specific administrative, technical, and physical safeguards, fully documented in writing, no later than the date of service of the order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Biennial Third-Party Security Assessments
provisions.summary: Respondents must obtain initial and biennial third-party security assessments from a qualified independent professional, covering specific criteria, with the initial assessment provided to the FTC within 10 days of completion.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondents must maintain and make available to the FTC compliance-related documents for specified periods, and provide them within 10 days of request.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgment and Delivery
provisions.summary: Respondents must deliver a copy of this order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, managers, employees, agents, and representatives with relevant responsibilities, within specified timeframes.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Notification of Corporate Changes
provisions.summary: Respondents must notify the FTC at least 30 days prior to any corporate change that may affect compliance obligations, including dissolution, merger, sale, subsidiary creation, bankruptcy, or name/address change.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondents must file a written compliance report with the FTC within 180 days after service of the order, and at such other times as the Commission may require.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Order Duration
provisions.summary: The order terminates on April 16, 2028, or 20 years from the most recent date the FTC files a federal court complaint alleging a violation, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Monitoring Technology Prohibited
provisions.summary: Respondent is permanently prohibited from using any monitoring technology to gather information or data from any computer rented to a consumer in connection with covered rent-to-own transactions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Use of Tracking Technology Limited
provisions.summary: Respondent may only use geophysical location tracking technology if clear and prominent notice is provided and affirmative express consent is obtained from the computer renter, with specific requirements for notice, consent, and icon display.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: No Deceptive Gathering of Consumer Information
provisions.summary: Respondent is permanently prohibited from making any false representation or depiction in any notice, prompt screen, or software application that results in gathering information from or about a consumer.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: No Use of Improperly Obtained Information in Collections
provisions.summary: Respondent is permanently prohibited from using any information or data obtained in violation of Parts I, II, and III when collecting or attempting to collect a debt pursuant to a covered rent-to-own transaction.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Protection of Data
provisions.summary: Respondent must delete all user data previously gathered using non-compliant monitoring or tracking technology, and must encrypt data during transmission from computers to servers.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: No Misrepresentations About Privacy
provisions.summary: Respondent is prohibited from misrepresenting the extent to which it maintains and protects the security, privacy, or confidentiality of personal information collected from or about consumers.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Distribution of Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of this order to all current and future personnel with responsibilities related to the order's subject matter, and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file compliance reports with the Commission, initially within 60 days and at other times as required, and provide notification of corporate changes affecting compliance obligations.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain documents related to compliance with Parts I-VI for five years after the last date of any covered act or practice, and make them available to the FTC for inspection.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Termination of Order
provisions.summary: Order will terminate on April 11, 2033, or twenty years from the most recent date the United States or FTC files a complaint alleging order violation, whichever is later, with provisions for extension if complaints are filed.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Monitoring Technology Prohibited
provisions.summary: Respondent is permanently prohibited from using any monitoring technology to gather information or data from any computer rented to a consumer in connection with covered rent-to-own transactions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Use of Tracking Technology Limited
provisions.summary: Respondent must provide clear and prominent notice and obtain affirmative express consent before using geophysical location tracking technology on rented computers, with specific requirements for notice delivery, consent mechanisms, and desktop icons.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: No Deceptive Gathering of Consumer Information
provisions.summary: Respondent is prohibited from making any false representation or depiction in any notice, prompt screen, or software application that results in gathering information from or about consumers, including location information.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: No Use of Improperly Obtained Information in Collections
provisions.summary: Respondent is prohibited from using any information or data obtained in a manner that does not comply with Parts I, II, and III when collecting or attempting to collect debts pursuant to covered rent-to-own transactions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Protection of Data
provisions.summary: Respondent must delete all user data previously gathered using non-compliant monitoring or tracking technology and must transmit data only in unreadable, unusable, or indecipherable form.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: No Misrepresentations About Privacy
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent, expressly or by implication, the extent to which it maintains and protects the security, privacy, or confidentiality of any personal information collected from or about consumers.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Distribution of Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver copies of this order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, and managers with responsibilities related to the order's subject matter and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting

provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain and make available to the FTC for five years all documents related to complaints about monitoring or tracking technologies, documents demonstrating compliance with the order, and acknowledgments of receipt of the order.

provisions.title: Termination of Order

provisions.summary: While Respondent engages in Targeted Advertising, it must place a clear opt-out hyperlink on its homepage, provide a disclosure and opt-out mechanism on the linked page, and describe the technologies used for Targeted Advertising — all within 30 days of service of the order.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Requirement to Honor Consumer Controls
provisions.summary: Respondent must honor signals indicating activation of a Mobile Operating System control to opt out of or limit Targeted Advertising when Respondent knows or reasonably should know it is receiving such a signal.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission may monitor Respondent's compliance by requesting additional reports, records, and interviews; communicating directly with Respondent; and using any other lawful means including undercover methods.

provisions.legal_authority: Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b), and Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.summary: Respondents must not misrepresent in any manner the extent to which they collect, use, maintain, disclose, or delete Covered Information, or the extent to which their Location Data is Deidentified.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Prohibitions on the Use, Sale, or Disclosure of Sensitive Location Data
provisions.summary: Respondents must not sell, license, transfer, share, disclose, or otherwise use Sensitive Location Data associated with identified Sensitive Locations, subject to narrow exceptions for data conversion or direct consumer relationships with Affirmative Express Consent.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Sensitive Location Data Program
provisions.summary: Respondents must establish and maintain a Sensitive Location Data Program within 180 days, including documented policies, a senior officer responsible, biannual assessments, technical controls, and timely deletion of Sensitive Location Data.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Other Location Data Obligations
provisions.summary: Respondents must establish within 180 days policies, procedures, and technical measures to prevent recipients of their Location Data from associating it with LGBTQ+ service locations, political/social demonstrations, or individuals' private residences, including contractual prohibitions, marking techniques, compliance assessments, and termination of non-compliant relationships.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Third-Party Incident Reports
provisions.summary: Within 30 days of determining a Third-Party Incident has occurred, Respondents must submit a report to the Commission including details about the incident, affected data, number of consumers affected, and remediation steps taken.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Limitations on Collection, Use, Maintenance, and Disclosure of Location Data
provisions.summary: Respondents must not collect or use Location Data where a consumer has opted out via OS privacy settings without documented consent, must not collect Location Data without documented prior consent within 90 days, and must provide Clear and Conspicuous quarterly reminders via Respondents' App.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Supplier Assessment Program
provisions.summary: Respondents must implement a Supplier Assessment Program within 90 days to ensure consumer consent for Location Data collection, including documented procedures, initial and annual assessments of third-party suppliers, consent records, and ceasing use of non-consented Location Data.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Disclosures to Consumers
provisions.summary: Respondents must provide consumers a Clear and Conspicuous means to request the identity of entities to whom their Location Data has been disclosed, or alternatively offer a deletion mechanism with confirmation to recipients within 90 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Withholding and Withdrawing Consent
provisions.summary: Respondents must provide a simple, easily-located means for consumers to withdraw consent for Location Data collection and must not unreasonably limit consumers' ability to withhold or withdraw consent through degradation of product quality or functionality.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Obligations When Consent is Withdrawn
provisions.summary: Respondents must cease collecting Location Data associated with a specific app and device within 15 days after receiving notice that a consumer has withdrawn their consent.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Location Data Deletion Requests
provisions.summary: Respondents must implement and maintain a simple, easily-located means for consumers to request deletion of their Location Data and must delete such data within 30 days of receiving a request.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Data Retention Limits
provisions.summary: Respondents must publish a Clear and Conspicuous data retention schedule on their website within 60 days, submit it to the Commission, and update it prior to collecting any new types of consumer information.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Deletion
provisions.summary: Respondents must delete Historic Location Data collected through their apps and SDK within 60 days (or obtain Affirmative Express Consent or Deidentify within 90 days), notify customers who received such data, and delete all Data Products within 90 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Mandated Privacy Program
provisions.summary: Respondents must establish and maintain a comprehensive privacy program within 60 days, including written documentation, board reporting, a designated coordinator, annual risk assessments, safeguards, annual employee training, and regular program evaluation.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondents must submit sworn acknowledgments of receipt of this Order within 10 days, deliver copies to key personnel within 10 days (and to future personnel before they assume responsibilities) for 5 years, and obtain signed acknowledgments from each recipient within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.summary: Respondents must submit an annual compliance report one year after the issuance date, provide notices within 14 days of any changes to contact points or corporate structure, and submit notice within 14 days of any bankruptcy filing.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondents must create and retain specified records for 5 years after the issuance date, including accounting records, personnel records, consumer complaints, law enforcement communications, representations about data practices, consent records, reminder records, supplier assessment records, sensitive location program records, deletion request records, and all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC may monitor Respondents' compliance by requesting additional reports and records within 14 days, communicating directly with and interviewing affiliated individuals, and using other lawful means including undercover methods.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act
