provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Prohibited Business Activities Regarding Consumer Personal Information
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently enjoined from making false or deceptive statements to obtain consumer personal information, and from directing others to obtain such information through deceptive means.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Monetary Relief
provisions.summary: A judgment of $67,000 is entered against Defendants jointly and severally, suspended upon payment of $3,000 to the FTC; funds are to be used for equitable consumer relief, and Defendants must provide tax identification numbers and cooperate with reporting.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Right to Reopen Judgment
provisions.summary: If the Court finds that any Defendant materially misrepresented or omitted information in their financial statements submitted to the FTC, the suspended judgment becomes immediately due and payable as to that Defendant.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Cooperation with FTC
provisions.summary: Defendants must cooperate in good faith with the FTC in connection with this action or related investigations, including appearing for interviews, discovery, and testimony upon written request.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC is authorized to monitor Defendants' compliance through written reports, document inspection, depositions, business entry, discovery, and posing as consumers or suppliers, and Defendants must permit FTC representatives to interview personnel.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting by Defendants
provisions.summary: For three years from entry of the Order, Defendants must notify the FTC of changes in residence, employment, business structure, and aliases; file periodic sworn compliance reports; and notify the FTC of any bankruptcy filing within 15 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Record Keeping
provisions.summary: For six years from entry of the Order, Defendants must create and retain specified business records including accounting records, personnel records, customer files, complaints, marketing materials, third-party records, and all compliance documentation.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Distribution of Order by Defendants
provisions.summary: For three years from entry of the Order, Defendants must deliver copies of the Order to relevant personnel in any business they own or control, within five days of service for current personnel and prior to assuming responsibilities for new personnel, and obtain signed receipts within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Acknowledgment of Receipt of Order by Defendants
provisions.summary: Each Defendant must submit a sworn statement acknowledging receipt of this Order to the FTC within five business days of receiving the entered Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction over this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of this Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Privacy and Security
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent the extent to which it uses, maintains, and protects the privacy, confidentiality, security, or integrity of personal information collected from or about consumers.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Comprehensive Information Security Program
provisions.summary: Respondent must establish and maintain a comprehensive information security program that is reasonably designed to protect the security, confidentiality, and integrity of personal information collected from or about consumers.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Third-Party Assessments
provisions.summary: Respondent must obtain initial and biennial assessments from a qualified, objective, independent third-party professional to evaluate the security program's compliance with Part II of the order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain and make available to the FTC for inspection all materials related to assessments and compliance with the order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgment
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver copies of the order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, managers, employees, agents, and representatives with relevant responsibilities, and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Change in Corporate Structure Notification
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the Commission at least thirty days prior to any change in the company that may affect compliance obligations, including dissolution, merger, sale, bankruptcy, or change in name or address.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file an initial compliance report with the Commission within sixty days after service of the order, and submit additional reports upon request.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: This order will terminate on April 29, 2033, or twenty years from the most recent date that the United States or the FTC files a complaint in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Disease Claims Require Two Clinical Studies
provisions.summary: Respondent must not make disease treatment claims for Covered Products unless substantiated by at least two adequate and well-controlled human clinical studies.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Health Benefit Claims Require Competent and Reliable Evidence
provisions.summary: Respondent must not make health benefit claims for Covered Products or Covered Assessments unless substantiated by competent and reliable scientific evidence.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent the existence, contents, validity, or results of any test or study, or that benefits are scientifically proven.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: FDA-Permitted Claims Exception
provisions.summary: Parts I-III do not prohibit representations specifically permitted by FDA regulations or approved drug applications.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Prohibition on Providing Means and Instrumentalities
provisions.summary: Respondent must not provide affiliates or others with materials that enable them to make prohibited representations.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Affiliate Monitoring and Compliance System
provisions.summary: Respondent must establish and maintain a system to monitor affiliates' representations and ensure compliance with Parts I-III.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Privacy Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent the extent to which it maintains and protects the privacy, confidentiality, security, or integrity of Personal Information.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Comprehensive Information Security Program
provisions.summary: Respondent must establish and maintain a comprehensive information security program to protect Personal Information with administrative, technical, and physical safeguards.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Third-Party Security Assessments
provisions.summary: Respondent must obtain initial and biennial third-party security assessments for twenty years.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Order Distribution and Acknowledgment
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of the order to current and future principals, officers, directors, and managerial employees, and obtain signed acknowledgments.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping Requirements
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain and make available to the FTC various records including Assessment materials and advertising substantiation.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Notification of Corporate Changes
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the FTC at least thirty days prior to corporate changes that may affect compliance obligations.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Compliance Reports
provisions.summary: Respondent must file an initial compliance report within sixty days and submit additional reports upon FTC request.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Order Termination
provisions.summary: The order will terminate on May 8, 2034, or twenty years from the most recent date the FTC files a complaint alleging violation, whichever comes later.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Prohibition on Disease Treatment Claims Without Substantiation
provisions.summary: Respondent must not make representations that Covered Products are effective in treating or preventing disease unless substantiated by at least two adequate and well-controlled human clinical studies.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Prohibition on Health Benefit Claims Without Substantiation
provisions.summary: Respondent must not make representations about health benefits, performance, or efficacy of Covered Products or Covered Assessments unless substantiated by competent and reliable scientific evidence.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Prohibition on Misrepresentations About Scientific Evidence
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent the existence, contents, validity, results, or conclusions of any test, study, or research, or that benefits are scientifically proven.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Safe Harbor for FDA-Approved Claims
provisions.summary: Parts I-III do not prohibit representations specifically permitted by FDA regulations or approved drug applications.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Prohibition on Providing Means and Instrumentalities
provisions.summary: Respondent must not provide licensees or affiliates with materials that would enable them to make prohibited representations.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Affiliate Monitoring and Compliance Program
provisions.summary: Respondent must establish and maintain a system to monitor affiliates' representations, including monthly reviews of top 50 affiliates and random samples, and terminate non-compliant affiliates within 7 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Prohibition on Privacy and Security Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent the extent to which it maintains and protects the privacy, confidentiality, security, or integrity of Personal Information.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Information Security Program
provisions.summary: Respondent must establish and maintain a comprehensive written information security program with administrative, technical, and physical safeguards to protect Personal Information.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Third-Party Security Assessments
provisions.summary: Respondent must obtain initial and biennial third-party security assessments for 20 years from qualified professionals (CISSP, CISA, or GIAC) and submit initial assessment to FTC within 10 days of completion.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgment and Delivery
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of the order to all principals, officers, directors, Scientific Advisory Board members, licensees, and managers, and secure signed acknowledgments.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping Requirements
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain and make available for FTC inspection assessment materials for 3 years and advertising materials and substantiation for 5 years after last dissemination.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Notification of Corporate Changes
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the FTC at least 30 days prior to any corporate change that may affect compliance obligations, including dissolution, merger, bankruptcy, or name/address changes.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file an initial compliance report within 60 days and submit additional reports within 10 days upon FTC request.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: The order will terminate on May 8, 2034, or 20 years from the most recent date the FTC files a complaint alleging violation, whichever is later.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Privacy or Security Programs
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent the extent to which it is a member of, adheres to, complies with, is certified by, is endorsed by, or otherwise participates in any privacy or security program sponsored by the government or any self-regulatory or standard-setting organization.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping Requirements
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain and make available to the FTC for inspection documents relating to compliance with this order for a period of five years from the date of preparation or dissemination.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgment and Distribution
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of this order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, managers, employees, agents, and representatives having responsibilities relating to the subject matter of this order, and must secure signed acknowledgments of receipt.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Notification of Corporate Changes
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the Commission at least thirty days prior to any change in the corporation that may affect compliance obligations arising under this order, including dissolution, assignment, sale, merger, creation or dissolution of subsidiaries, bankruptcy filing, or change in corporate name or address.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file with the Commission a true and accurate report setting forth in detail the manner and form of its compliance with this order within sixty days after service, and must submit additional reports within ten days of written notice from the Commission.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: This order will terminate on May 20, 2035, or twenty years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Privacy and Security Programs
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent the extent to which it is a member of, adheres to, complies with, is certified by, is endorsed by, or otherwise participates in any privacy or security program sponsored by the government or any self-regulatory or standard-setting organization.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Alternative Dispute Resolution
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent its participation in, or the rules, processes, policies, or costs of, any alternative dispute resolution process or service.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain and make available to the FTC for inspection all documents relating to compliance with this order for a period of five years.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Acknowledgment of Receipt of Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of this order to current and future personnel with relevant responsibilities and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Notification of Corporate Changes
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the Commission at least 30 days prior to any change in the corporation that may affect compliance obligations, including dissolution, merger, bankruptcy, or change in corporate name or address.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file a compliance report with the Commission within 60 days of service of the order and submit additional reports upon request.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: This order will terminate on May 20, 2035, or 20 years from the most recent date that the United States or Commission files a complaint in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Encryption and Security
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent the encryption capabilities, regulatory compliance assistance, or privacy and security protections of any product or service that collects or stores Personal Information.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Customer Notification About Dentrix G5 Encryption
provisions.summary: Respondent must clearly and conspicuously notify Affected Customers that Dentrix G5 uses a less complex encryption algorithm than AES, the NIST-recommended industry standard, following specific identification, mailing, and reporting procedures.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Monetary Payment to the Commission
provisions.summary: Respondent must pay $250,000 to the Commission within eight days of the effective date of the order via electronic fund transfer.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Administration of Consumer Redress Fund
provisions.summary: Money paid to the Commission may be used for consumer redress or related relief; default on payment accrues interest and accelerates the full amount due; each day of nonpayment is a separate violation subject to civil penalty.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Provision of Customer Information for Redress
provisions.summary: Respondent must provide sufficient customer information to enable the Commission to efficiently administer consumer redress, and must supply any requested redress-related information within fourteen days.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping of Advertising and Promotional Materials
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain all advertisements, supporting materials, and contradictory evidence related to any covered representation for five years after last dissemination, and make them available to the Commission upon request.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Order Delivery and Acknowledgment
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of this order to current and future principals, officers, directors, managers, and employees with relevant managerial responsibilities, and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt within thirty days of delivery.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Notification of Corporate Changes
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the Commission at least thirty days before any corporate change that may affect compliance obligations under the order, including dissolution, merger, sale, bankruptcy, or name/address change.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting to the Commission
provisions.summary: Respondent must file an initial written compliance report within sixty days of service of the order, and additional reports within ten days of written notice from a Commission representative.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: This order terminates on May 20, 2036, or twenty years from the most recent date a complaint alleging a violation of the order is filed in federal court, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq.

provisions.title: Prohibition against Misrepresentations about Privacy and Security
provisions.summary: Respondent and all persons acting with it must not misrepresent in any way the extent to which it maintains and protects the security of Covered Devices or the privacy, security, confidentiality, or integrity of Personal Information.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Mandated Device Security and Information Security Program
provisions.summary: Respondent must establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive Security Program protecting Covered Devices and Personal Information, satisfying numerous specific sub-requirements including documentation, risk assessments, safeguards, training, testing, and service provider oversight.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Device and Information Security Assessments by a Third Party
provisions.summary: Respondent must obtain initial and biennial third-party security assessments by a qualified, independent Assessor covering the Security Program, with specific requirements for Assessor qualifications, reporting periods, content, and submission to the FTC.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Cooperation with Third Party Information Security Assessor
provisions.summary: Respondent must provide the Assessor with all relevant information and materials, and must not withhold material facts or misrepresent any facts material to the Assessor's determinations.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Annual Certification
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit annual certifications from a senior corporate manager or officer attesting to compliance with the Order, awareness of any material noncompliance, and describing any Covered Incidents, submitted to the FTC via specified channels.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit an acknowledgment of receipt of the Order to the FTC within ten days, deliver copies of the Order to relevant personnel and business successors for 20 years, and obtain signed acknowledgments from each recipient within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Compliance Report and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must file a sworn compliance report one year after issuance, submit compliance notices within 14 days of certain changes in structure or contact information, notify the FTC of any bankruptcy filing within 14 days, and ensure all sworn submissions meet the specified format and delivery requirements.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create and retain specific categories of records for 20 years after the Order's issuance, with each record retained for five years, covering financial records, personnel records, consumer complaints, marketing materials, security representations, Assessment materials, law enforcement communications, and all compliance records.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC has the right to monitor Respondent's compliance by requesting additional reports and records, communicating directly with and interviewing Respondent's affiliates, and using all other lawful means including undercover investigations.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: The Order is effective upon publication on the FTC's website and terminates on May 18, 2040, or 20 years from the most recent date a complaint is filed in federal court alleging a violation, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1)

provisions.title: Prohibition against Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent in any manner how it collects, uses, discloses, maintains, or deletes Covered Information, or how it protects the privacy, security, and integrity of that information.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Notice and Affirmative Express Consent Provision
provisions.summary: Before using Biometric Information collected from a User to create a Face Embedding or train/develop/alter any face recognition model or algorithm, Respondent must clearly disclose all purposes for which it will use the information and obtain affirmative express consent from the User.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Deletion
provisions.summary: Respondent must delete or destroy photos, videos, Face Embeddings, and Affected Work Product collected from certain Users within specified timeframes after the Order's issuance, and provide sworn written statements to the Commission confirming such deletion.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must acknowledge receipt of this Order, deliver copies to relevant personnel and successors, and collect signed acknowledgments from each recipient.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Reports and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit a sworn compliance report one year after the Order's issuance, provide timely notices of changes in contact information or business structure, and notify the Commission of any bankruptcy filings.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create and retain specified categories of records for 10 years after the Order's issuance, retaining each record for at least 5 years.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC is authorized to monitor Respondent's compliance by requesting reports and records, communicating directly with and interviewing Respondent's personnel, and using other lawful means including undercover methods.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: This Order is effective upon publication on ftc.gov and terminates 20 years from its issuance date, or 20 years from the most recent date the Commission files a complaint alleging a violation, whichever is later.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Prohibited Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Respondent and those acting with it must not make any misrepresentation about product reviews or endorsements, including about whether reviews reflect all purchasers' views, whether reviews are unedited, whether reviews are presented regardless of rating, or how reviews factor into overall ratings.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Product Review Display
provisions.summary: Respondent must display all consumer-submitted reviews for products currently for sale on its websites, including previously withheld reviews, subject to limited exceptions for off-topic, unlawful, or inappropriate content.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Monetary Relief
provisions.summary: Respondent must pay $4,200,000 to the Commission within 8 days of the effective date of the Order by electronic fund transfer.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Additional Monetary Provisions
provisions.summary: Respondent relinquishes all rights to transferred assets, agrees that complaint facts may be used in future litigation, and acknowledges rules governing use of paid funds, default interest, civil penalties for nonpayment, and reporting of its taxpayer ID.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit a sworn acknowledgment of receipt to the Commission within 10 days, deliver copies of the Order to relevant personnel within 10 days (and to future personnel before they assume responsibilities), and obtain signed acknowledgments from recipients within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Reports and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit a sworn compliance report 90 days after the Order is issued, and must submit sworn notices within 14 days of any change in contact points, business structure, or bankruptcy filings; all submissions must follow specified formatting and delivery requirements.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create specified records for 10 years and retain each for 5 years, including accounting records, personnel records, consumer complaints, compliance records, marketing materials, product reviews submitted, and records showing any lack of compliance.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission has broad rights to monitor compliance, including requesting additional reports and records within 10 days, interviewing Respondent's personnel, and using undercover methods without prior notice.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: The Order is effective upon publication on the FTC's website and terminates 20 years from issuance or 20 years from the most recent federal court complaint alleging a violation, whichever is later, with limited exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Disclosure of Treatment Information and Covered Information for Advertising Purposes
provisions.summary: Respondent is prohibited from disclosing Treatment Information or Covered Information to any Third Party for advertising, marketing, or promotional purposes targeting the consumer to whom the information pertains.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Affirmative Express Consent
provisions.summary: Within 30 days of the Order's effective date, Respondent must obtain a consumer's Affirmative Express Consent before disclosing that consumer's Covered Information to any Third Party.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Privacy of Covered Information
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent in any manner, expressly or by implication, how it collects, uses, shares, or protects Covered Information, including claims about privacy controls, HIPAA compliance, or membership in privacy programs.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Data Deletion
provisions.summary: Respondent must identify all Third Parties that received Covered Information without consumer consent, notify and instruct those Third Parties to delete such information, and cease disclosing information to or using those Third Parties for advertising until deletion is confirmed.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Notice to Users
provisions.summary: Within 14 days of the Order's effective date, Respondent must email all Covered Users an exact copy of the attached Exhibit A notice, with no additional materials included.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Mandated Privacy Program
provisions.summary: Within 60 days of the Order's effective date, each Covered Business must establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive privacy program protecting the privacy, security, availability, confidentiality, and integrity of Covered Information, with specific written, operational, and technical requirements.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Privacy Assessments by a Third-Party Assessor
provisions.summary: Respondent must obtain initial and biennial independent third-party privacy assessments covering the Privacy Program required by Provision VI, with the initial assessment covering the first 240 days and subsequent assessments covering each 2-year period for 20 years.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Cooperation with Assessor
provisions.summary: Respondent must fully cooperate with the third-party Assessor by providing all relevant information, disclosing all material facts, and not misrepresenting any fact material to the Assessment.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Annual Certification
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit annual certifications from a senior corporate manager to the FTC for 10 years confirming compliance with the Order, identifying any material noncompliance, and describing any Covered Incidents.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Covered Incident Reports
provisions.summary: Within 30 days of discovering a Covered Incident, Respondent must submit a detailed report to the FTC including the incident's date, description, number of affected consumers, remediation steps taken, and copies of any consumer or government notices.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Monetary Relief
provisions.summary: Respondent must pay $7,800,000 to the FTC within 8 days of the Order's effective date by electronic fund transfer.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Additional Monetary Provisions
provisions.summary: Respondent relinquishes all rights to transferred assets, acknowledges that complaint facts may be used in future litigation, and agrees that FTC-administered funds may be used for consumer redress or other related relief.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Independent Redress Administrator
provisions.summary: An independent third-party Redress Administrator, selected by Commission staff, shall be appointed to administer consumer redress; Respondent must cooperate fully and is responsible for all associated costs.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit a sworn acknowledgment of receipt of the Order to the FTC within 10 days, deliver copies to all key personnel and future personnel, and obtain signed acknowledgments from each recipient within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Reports and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit sworn compliance reports to the FTC 180 days after the effective date and annually for five more years, and must promptly notify the FTC of changes to contact information, business structure, or bankruptcy filings.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create and retain specified records for 20 years after the Order's issuance date, with each record retained for at least 5 years, including accounting records, personnel records, consumer complaints, disclosure records, marketing materials, privacy representations, assessment materials, law enforcement communications, and compliance records.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC is authorized to monitor Respondent's compliance through written requests for information and records, direct communications and interviews with Respondent's affiliates, and other lawful investigative means including undercover operations.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: This Order is effective upon publication on the FTC's website and will terminate 20 years from issuance, or 20 years from the most recent date a complaint is filed in federal court alleging a violation, whichever is later.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Privacy and Security
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent in any manner how it maintains, uses, deletes, or discloses Covered Information, the extent to which it protects that information, or the scope of any unauthorized incident or disclosure.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Mandated Data Deletion
provisions.summary: Respondent must delete or destroy customer backup files containing Covered Information not needed for service delivery within 90 days, confirm deletion in writing, and refrain from retaining Covered Information beyond what is necessary.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Data Retention Limits
provisions.summary: Respondent must document and publicly post a retention schedule for customer backup files containing Covered Information within 90 days, and report that schedule to the Commission in writing.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Mandated Information Security Program
provisions.summary: Respondent must establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive information security program within 90 days of the Order Effective Date, meeting at minimum fourteen detailed sub-requirements covering documentation, governance, risk assessment, safeguards, testing, and service provider oversight.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Information Security Assessments by a Third Party
provisions.summary: Respondent must obtain initial and biennial third-party assessments of its Information Security Program from a qualified, independent Assessor approved by the FTC, with specific reporting periods, completion deadlines, and submission requirements.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Cooperation with Third Party Information Security Assessor
provisions.summary: Respondent must fully cooperate with the third-party Assessor by providing all relevant information, network/IT asset visibility, and disclosing all material facts without misrepresentation.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Annual Certification
provisions.summary: Respondent's Chief Information Security Officer must annually certify to the FTC that the Order's requirements have been established, implemented, and maintained, and that all material noncompliance has been corrected or disclosed, including a description of all Covered Incidents during the certified period.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Covered Incident Reports
provisions.summary: Within 10 days of notifying any U.S. government entity of a Covered Incident, Respondent must submit a detailed report to the FTC including dates, facts, types of information affected, number of customers affected, remediation steps taken, and copies of notices sent.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgements
provisions.summary: Respondent must acknowledge receipt of the Order, deliver copies to all relevant officers, employees, and agents, and obtain signed acknowledgments from each recipient.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit a sworn compliance report one year after the Order's issuance, notify the Commission within 14 days of structural or contact changes for 20 years, and notify the Commission within 14 days of any bankruptcy filing.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create and retain specific records for 5 years, generated over a 20-year period, including accounting records, personnel records, consumer complaints, compliance documents, and copies of advertising materials related to privacy and data security.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC may monitor Respondent's compliance through requests for reports and documents, depositions, direct communication with Respondent's personnel, and other lawful means including undercover activity.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates and Duration
provisions.summary: The Order becomes effective upon publication on the FTC's website and terminates 20 years from issuance, or 20 years from the most recent date a complaint is filed in federal court alleging a violation, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Prohibition on Use or Disclosure of Covered Information for Defined Advertising Purposes
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently prohibited from using or disclosing Covered Information for advertising or marketing purposes (Defined Advertising Purposes) or for any third party's purposes, with a narrow exception for Limited Visitor Data used for analytics and reporting.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Affirmative Express Consent
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently prohibited from disclosing any consumer's Covered Information to any Outside Party without first obtaining that consumer's Affirmative Express Consent.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations Regarding Privacy and Data Practices
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently prohibited from misrepresenting any aspect of its privacy, confidentiality, or security practices, including how Covered Information is collected, used, or disclosed, and any other material facts about its products or services.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations Related to Negative Options
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently prohibited from misrepresenting any material aspect of its Negative Option Feature offers, including cancellation terms, costs, free-trial claims, billing authorization, and refund or cancellation policies.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Mandated Privacy and Information Security Program
provisions.summary: Defendant must establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive privacy and information security program within 60 days of entry of the Order, including documentation, board reporting, risk assessments, safeguards, employee training, access controls, encryption, source code reviews, vendor management, and merger/acquisition compliance.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Independent Mandated Program Assessments
provisions.summary: Defendant must obtain initial and biennial independent third-party assessments of the privacy and security Program, covering the first 180 days after the Program is established and then every two years for 20 years, with each Assessment submitted to the FTC within 10 days of completion.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Cooperation with Assessor
provisions.summary: Defendant must provide Assessors with all relevant information and materials and must not misrepresent any material facts to the Assessor in connection with any mandated Assessment.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Annual Certifications
provisions.summary: Defendant must annually provide the FTC with a certification from a senior corporate manager confirming that the Program has been established and maintained, that there is no uncorrected material noncompliance, and describing any Covered Incidents during the period.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Covered Incident Reports
provisions.summary: Defendant must report each Covered Incident to the Assessor and FTC within 30 days of discovery, with updates every 30 days until fully resolved, and publish a public version of the report on its websites and apps within 45 days of verification.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Notice to Users
provisions.summary: Within 14 days of the Order, Defendant must post a prescribed Notice on its websites and apps and email it to all consumers who provided Covered Information between October 2019 and March 1, 2023, keeping the Notice in place for two years.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Data Retention Limits and Deletion of Covered Information and Data Product
provisions.summary: Defendant must document a retention schedule within 7 days, delete all Covered Information not used for Treatment, Payment, or Health Care Operations within 60 days, provide a consumer deletion request mechanism within 60 days, identify all third-party recipients within 30 days, and instruct those third parties to delete Covered Information within 60 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Required Disclosures Relating to Negative Option Feature
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently prohibited from promoting any Negative Option Feature without making specific Clear and Conspicuous disclosures about costs, affirmative action required to avoid charges, recurring charge deadlines, and cancellation mechanisms; and must send written transaction confirmations to consumers.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Obtaining Express Informed Consent for a Negative Option
provisions.summary: Defendant must obtain the consumer's express informed consent before using Billing Information for a Negative Option Feature, through a standalone affirmative checkbox or signature for written offers, or oral confirmation for telephone offers, with voice recordings retained for 3 years for telemarketing transactions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Simple Mechanism to Cancel Negative Option Feature
provisions.summary: Defendant must provide consumers with a simple, easy-to-find, and easy-to-use cancellation mechanism that does not require unnecessary steps or use Dark Patterns, available through the same channel (Internet, phone, or mail) through which the consumer enrolled.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Monetary Judgments for Monetary Relief and Civil Penalty
provisions.summary: Defendant is ordered to pay $5,087,252.89 as monetary relief and $10,000,000 as a civil penalty, with $2,000,000 of the civil penalty paid immediately (the remainder suspended based on Defendant's financial representations) and the monetary relief paid within 7 days of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Additional Monetary Provisions
provisions.summary: Defendant relinquishes all rights to transferred assets, the Complaint's facts may be taken as true in future proceedings, and monetary relief funds may be used for consumer redress or, if impracticable, for related relief or deposited into the U.S. Treasury as an additional civil penalty.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Independent Redress Administrator
provisions.summary: If the FTC determines redress is practicable, an independent redress administrator will be appointed; Defendant must provide Eligible Customer information within 7 days of notification, cooperate fully with the Administrator, and pay all Administrator costs and fees.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgments
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit a sworn acknowledgment of receipt of the Order within 7 days, deliver copies of the Order to all relevant personnel and businesses within 7 days (or before they assume responsibilities), and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit a sworn compliance report one year after the Order's entry and submit sworn compliance notices within 14 days of any change in points of contact or corporate structure for 20 years; all submissions must be made to the FTC via email or overnight courier.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Defendant must create and retain for 5 years (over a 20-year period) accounting records, personnel records, consumer complaint records, all compliance records, and copies of all marketing materials related to health services and Negative Option Feature products.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission and Plaintiff are authorized to monitor Defendant's compliance through compliance reports, depositions, document production, and direct communications with Defendant and its employees; Defendant must comply with written requests within 14 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Cooperation
provisions.summary: Defendant must fully cooperate with Plaintiff and the Commission in this case and any related investigation, providing truthful and complete information and causing its personnel to appear for proceedings upon 5 days' written notice.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction over this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Respondent must not materially misrepresent the extent to which it collects, uses, maintains, discloses, or deletes Location Data, or the extent to which that Location Data is Deidentified.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Prohibition on the Sale or Licensing of Location Data
provisions.summary: Respondent must not sell or license Location Data in exchange for any valuable consideration.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Prohibition on Products or Services Categorizing or Targeting Consumers Based on Sensitive Location Data
provisions.summary: Respondent must not use, sell, license, transfer, or otherwise share any products or services that categorize or target consumers based on Sensitive Location Data associated with identified Sensitive Locations, except as necessary to comply with Provision IV.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Sensitive Location Data Program
provisions.summary: Respondent must establish, implement, and maintain a Sensitive Location Data Program within 90 days to prevent use, sale, licensing, transfer, or sharing of products or services that categorize or target consumers based on Sensitive Location Data.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Other Limitations on Collection, Use, Maintenance, and Disclosure of Location Data Absent Affirmative Express Consent
provisions.summary: Respondent must not collect, use, maintain, or disclose a consumer's Location Data through any Respondent App without documented Affirmative Express Consent and without providing a Clear and Conspicuous reminder at least every six months.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: SDK Supplier Assessment Program
provisions.summary: Respondent must implement and maintain an SDK Supplier Assessment Program within 90 days to ensure consumers have consented to the collection and use of Location Data obtained through Respondent's SDK.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Withholding and Withdrawing Affirmative Express Consent
provisions.summary: Respondent must provide consumers with a simple means to withdraw Affirmative Express Consent and must not unreasonably limit a consumer's ability to withhold or withdraw consent.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Obligations When Affirmative Express Consent is Withdrawn
provisions.summary: Respondent must cease collecting all Location Data from a specific Respondent App on a device within 7 days after receiving notice that the consumer has withdrawn Affirmative Express Consent.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Location Data Deletion Requests
provisions.summary: Respondent must implement and maintain a simple means for consumers to request deletion of their Location Data and must delete such data within 30 days of the request.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Data Retention Limits
provisions.summary: Respondent must document, adhere to, and publish a retention schedule for Covered Information within 60 days, report it to the Commission, and update the schedule before collecting any new types of Covered Information.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Notice to Consumers
provisions.summary: Within 45 days of the effective date, Respondent must provide notice to each consumer whose Location Data it collected and used through any Respondent App without a record of Affirmative Express Consent, via email and in-app notice.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Deletion
provisions.summary: Respondent must delete Historic Location Data collected through Respondent Apps within 90 days, delete or Deidentify Historic Location Data collected from third parties within 120 days, and delete audience segments created using Historic Location Data within 120 days, unless prohibited by law.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Mandated Privacy Program
provisions.summary: Respondent must establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive privacy program within 60 days of Order issuance that includes documented safeguards, risk assessments, training, and regular evaluations.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit a sworn acknowledgment of receipt of the Order within 10 days, deliver copies to current and future relevant personnel, and obtain signed acknowledgments from each recipient within 30 days of delivery.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Report and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must file a sworn annual compliance report one year after issuance, submit sworn notices within 14 days of changes to contact information or business structure, and notify the Commission within 14 days of any bankruptcy filing.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create specified categories of records for 20 years after Order issuance and retain each such record for 5 years, covering financials, personnel, consumer complaints, law enforcement communications, privacy representations, consent records, and reminder distribution records.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to monitor Respondent's compliance by requesting additional reports and records, interviewing affiliated personnel, and using all other lawful means including undercover methods.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: The Order is effective upon publication on ftc.gov as a final order and terminates 20 years from the date of issuance, or 20 years from the most recent date a complaint alleging any violation is filed in federal court, whichever comes later.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Order Directing Further Reply
provisions.summary: Respondent Meta Platforms, Inc. is directed to file a reply addressing the legal issues raised by Complaint Counsel's Reply within thirty days of this order.

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Respondents must not misrepresent in any manner the extent to which they protect the security or availability of any Hosting Service, Covered Information, or their participation in any privacy or security program.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Mandated Information Security Program
provisions.summary: Respondents must establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive information security program within 90 days, satisfying numerous specific sub-requirements covering documentation, risk assessment, safeguards, monitoring, testing, and vendor management.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Information Security Assessments by a Third Party
provisions.summary: Respondents must obtain initial and biennial third-party assessments of their Information Security Program from a qualified, independent assessor approved by the FTC, covering the first 12 months and each subsequent 2-year period for 20 years.

provisions.title: Cooperation with Third Party Information Security Assessor
provisions.summary: Respondents must fully cooperate with the third-party Assessor by providing all relevant information, network access, and disclosing all material facts without misrepresentation.

provisions.title: Annual Certification
provisions.summary: Respondents must submit an annual certification from a senior executive officer attesting to compliance with the Order, absence of uncorrected material noncompliance, and a description of all Covered Incidents during the certified period.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Covered Incident Reports
provisions.summary: Within 10 days of notifying any U.S. government entity of a Covered Incident, the affected Respondent must submit a detailed report to the Commission describing the incident, affected information, and remediation steps taken.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondents must acknowledge receipt of the Order, deliver copies to all principals, officers, and relevant employees and agents, and obtain signed acknowledgments from each recipient within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.summary: Respondents must not misrepresent in any manner the extent to which they maintain and protect the privacy, confidentiality, or security of personal information collected from or about consumers, in connection with any online advertising, marketing, or sale of products or services.

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently restrained from misrepresenting, or assisting others in misrepresenting, key facts about their business including location, product qualities, warranties, pricing, compliance program membership, and cancellation/refund policies.

provisions.title: Ban on Use of Foreign Website Designations
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently prohibited from selling goods over the Internet using any website domain name, extension, or suffix associated with a country other than the United States, unless actually located and doing business in that foreign country.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and the Commission's Trade Regulation Rule Concerning the Sale of Mail or Telephone Order Merchandise (Mail Order Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 435

provisions.title: Ban on Credit or Debit Card Charges Before Readiness to Ship
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently prohibited from charging consumer credit cards, debit cards, gift cards, or bank accounts for goods until they have actually obtained the goods and are ready to ship them.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and the Commission's Trade Regulation Rule Concerning the Sale of Mail or Telephone Order Merchandise (Mail Order Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 435

provisions.title: Compliance with Mail Order Rule
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently enjoined from violating any provision of the Mail Order Rule, including specific requirements around shipping time disclosures, delay options, revised shipping dates, renewed delay options, cancellation notices, and prompt refunds.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and the Commission's Trade Regulation Rule Concerning the Sale of Mail or Telephone Order Merchandise (Mail Order Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 435

provisions.summary: Defendants must not oppose or contest customer chargebacks made prior to twelve months from the date of entry of this Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a), and the Commission's Trade Regulation Rule Concerning the Sale of Mail or Telephone Order Merchandise (Mail Order Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 435

provisions.title: Monetary Relief
provisions.summary: Defendants are ordered to pay $500,000 in equitable monetary relief to the Commission, with payment suspended subject to the provisions of Section VII.

provisions.title: Right to Reopen / Suspension of Monetary Judgment
provisions.summary: The $500,000 monetary judgment suspension is premised on the truthfulness of Defendants' financial statements; if material misrepresentation is found, the suspension is lifted and the full amount becomes due. Funds paid go toward consumer redress, with any remainder deposited in the U.S. Treasury.
